intro: Ibidium longilabre, commonly known as the long-lipped ibidium, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically feature a long, narrow lip. Its leaves are usually alternate and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
